title: Replace `asyncio` with `concurrent.futures`
body:
Resolves:

- https://github.com/Vlsir/Vlsir/issues/56
- https://github.com/Vlsir/Vlsir/issues/61
- https://github.com/dan-fritchman/Hdl21/issues/122

Twinned with:

- https://github.com/dan-fritchman/Hdl21/pull/143

Major changes:

- Scrub `asyncio` from VLSIR and deprecate any `*_async` functions
- Use `concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor` for multithreading in both `spice.py` and `xyce.py`
- Removed `async` tests, did not replace with new tests for parallelism

title: ProtoBuf v4.23(!). Revert nested async. SpicePrefix -> SpiceType.
feat: support `sim()` in top-level asyncio (e.g. jupyter)
body:
A hacky way to get around nested asyncio. Not the best practice for sure but does the job.

An alternative is to use `https://github.com/erdewit/nest_asyncio` but it introduces extra dependency.

Or we can stick to the practice to always asyncio so this async to sync transition doesn't exist.

title: Update tests.yaml
body: Think it's a linux-y package manager issue, this would be my first guess.

title: SPICE Options + Julia Bindings
body:
## Description

- Fixed options parsing in protobuf to use Structs
- Updated Rust `build.rs` and versions for compatability/security 
- Updated `ngspice.py` in Vlsirtools to interact with Options
- Introduced Julia bindings for future projects.
- Updated Github Actions to have seperate scripts for seperate builds
 
## Related PRs and issues

Issue #44 - Updated `Cargo.toml` uses latest prost version

## Additional notes

- Layout21 update needed to interact with new prost versions/libs. 
- Julia ProtoBuf.jl does not yet parse service/RPC in spice.proto.
- Registering Vlsir.jl in Julia's package manager

### Edit:

In light of:
- https://github.com/dan-fritchman/Hdl21/pull/111 I've decided to add some addition goals to this PR to resolve the issues listed in the above PR and #22 and #38. I've converted this into a draft to host the other necessary changes.

title: #41 Github Actions with Testing Container
body:
Proposed solution to Issue #41:

[Ubuntu 22.0.4 Testing Container](https://github.com/ThomasPluck/vlsir-test-container) with following packages installed:

- Xyce 7.6.0
- NgSpice 38+
- iVerilog 11.0.1
- Deadsnakes PPA (allows APT to install all Python versions)

All skip tests removed aside from Spectre. All tests pass except NgSpice noise analysis test.

title: #12 Xyce SimData-format results. #35 SimResults accessors & indexing
VlsirTools Xyce bug fixes. Vdc primitive gets a default ac value, zero.
Updated primitives to fix issue with vcvs and vsin
Schema source returns to protos/. As of separate-schema repo commit 0ad86f1.
VlsirTools ngspice support
body:
NGSpice is the other open source simulator along with xyce, this adds support for OP, AC, and TRAN sims with NGSPICE. 

Note that this merge makes a small change to the netlisting code. This will require fixes in other repos dependent on vlsirtools based netlisting

title: Add build script test workflow
body: Adds a github workflow job to test running the build script `scripts/build.sh`.

title: More Catching up to Schema
Check out schema protos every build
body: Not submodules, not buf.build, just a dumb clone every time we run build.sh.

title: Adding AC and DC analysis support for xyce.py
Add Primitive Definitions
body:
* Adds "message literal" definitions for primitive elements, in protobuf-text format. 
* Adds a (python) script which generates those definitions 
* (TBC) updates netlisting to use said primitives, rather than relying on HDL21.

title: Spectre simulator support
body: This is a first pass at supporting Spectre simulations and parsing spice raw files. To be added: Support for DC and AC.
